info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 29 at 2:27PM HST until March 29 at 5:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 530 PM HST. * At 227 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain continuing over saturated ground across the southern portion of the island of Kauai. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 3 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Kekaha, Lawai, Omao, Hanapepe, Koloa, North Fork Wailua Trails, Poipu, Waimea, Wailua Homesteads, Wailua, Mana, Barking Sands, Eleele, Kaumakani, Puhi, Pakala Village and Wailua River State Park. This warning may need to be extended beyond 530 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
